com.atakmap.android.maps

Class MapItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.maps.FilterMetaDataHolder
      • com.atakmap.android.maps.MapItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    URIContent, HashtagContent, MetaDataHolder, VisibilityListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CrumbTrail, PersistentCircleCrumbTrail, PointMapItem, Shape

    public abstract class MapItem
extends FilterMetaDataHolder
implements HashtagContent, VisibilityListener
    Abstract base for a map engine entity. All MapItems are observable by setting listeners for value changes on members called 'properties'. Each property is individually observable, but many of the core engine components set listeners for every property to properly implement functionality. Generally, client code will not add listeners, but MapComponents will. Listeners should be removed by the same classes that add them.

    MapItem has the following properties:

  • clickable affects touch interaction
  • visible affects draw visibility and touch interaction
  • zOrder affects draw order (lower appears above higher)

    • Notable UserControlComponent (touch) behavior:

  • clickable set as false will cause the item to be skipped when handling touch events
  • visible set as false will cause the item to be skipped when handling touch events
  • Lower zOrder values will be hit-tested first possibly causing propagation to skip higher zOrder items

    • Notable GLMapComponent (graphics) behavior:

  • When visible is false, no element of the MapItem is drawn
  • A lower zOrder will be drawn over a higher zOrder

    • Field Detail

      • ZORDER_RENDER_COMPARATOR

        public static final java.util.Comparator<MapItem> ZORDER_RENDER_COMPARATOR
        Orders by Z-order, DESCENDING. This is an appropriate ordering for purposes of rendering: low Z-order MapItems are rendered after (atop) high Z-order MapItems. When Z-order values are the same, lower serial ID appears first in sort order (rendering more recently created MapItems atop earlier MapItems).

      • ZORDER_HITTEST_COMPARATOR

        public static final java.util.Comparator<MapItem> ZORDER_HITTEST_COMPARATOR
        Orders by Z-order, ASCENDING. This is an appropriate ordering for purposes of hit-testing. It is the reverse of the order produced by the ZORDER_RENDER_COMPARATOR.

      • testOrthoHit

        @Deprecated
public boolean testOrthoHit(int xpos,
                                        int ypos,
                                        GeoPoint point,
                                        MapView view)
        Deprecated. Hit-testing is now handled by implementing HitTestable#hitTest(MapRenderer3, HitTestQueryParameters) in the GL counterpart for this map item.
        Test if a pixel is contained within the bounds of the MapItem on the orthographic projected map.
        Parameters:
        xpos - pixel x location (increases left -> right)
        ypos - pixel y location (increases top -> bottom)
        point - the pixel location as projected onto the map surface (lat, lng of pixel location)
        view - the map view
        Returns:
        true when a hit occurs

      • persist

        public void persist(MapEventDispatcher dispatcher,
                    android.os.Bundle persistExtras,
                    java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Dispatches a persist event for the MapItem. The refresh event will signal interested components that the item should be persisted to its storage.

        By default, the event will be dispatched with the extra, "internal", set to true. This may be overridden by setting the parameter in persistExtras to an alternate value.

        Parameters:
        dispatcher - The event dispatcher
        persistExtras - An optional bundle of extras to be sent with the event; may be null
        clazz - the class that made this persist call See MapEvent.ITEM_PERSIST

      • refresh

        public void refresh(MapEventDispatcher dispatcher,
                    android.os.Bundle refreshExtras,
                    java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Dispatches a refresh event for the MapItem. The refresh event will signal interested components that the metadata properties of the item have changed.
        Parameters:
        dispatcher - The event dispatcher
        refreshExtras - An optional bundle of extras to be sent with the event; may be null See MapEvent.ITEM_REFRESH

      • getRemarksKey

        protected java.lang.String getRemarksKey()
        Get the metadata key for where remarks are stored 99.9% of the time this is just "remarks". But unfortunately some items, such as CASEVAC, use a different key.
        Returns:
        Remarks metadata key
